info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued January 09 at 6:13AM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...The Forest Service Sawtooth Avalanche Center in Ketchum has ISSUED a BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WARNING which is in effect until 4 AM MST Wednesday... * WHAT...The avalanche danger will rise to HIGH by Tuesday afternoon. * WHERE...The Sawtooth, Western Smoky, and Soldier Mountains, including the mountains near Atlanta, Stanley, Smiley Creek, and Fairfield. The backcountry avalanche warning does not apply to operating ski areas. * WHEN...Until 4 AM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...An intense winter storm bringing heavy snowfall and strong wind is overloading a very weak snowpack. Very dangerous conditions will develop by Tuesday afternoon. Human-triggered avalanches large enough to bury you are almost certain. Very large natural avalanches are expected. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Very dangerous avalanche conditions exist. Travel in avalanche terrain is not recommended. Stay off of and out from below steep slopes-slopes steeper than about 30 degrees. Avalanches may be triggered remotely-from flat terrain above, below, and to the sides of steeps slopes. Natural and human-triggered avalanches may run long distances and can impact gentler terrain below. Consult www.sawtoothavalanche.com or www.avalanche.org for more detailed information. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.
